title: Laurent Blanc 'keeping tabs' on Man Utd job amid Ole Gunnar Solskjaer sack fears

Former France and Paris Saint-Germain manager Lauren Blanc is reportedly keen on replacing under-pressure Ole Gunnar Solskjaer at Manchester United .

Blanc, who enjoyed a two-year playing spell with United before hanging up his boots, was recently linked with the vacant managerial position at Lyon.

However the 53-year-old boss, whose last job was with PSG three years ago, has been unable to agree personal terms with the French club and has been forced to go back to the drawing board.

And reports in France claim that one job which interests him is the United position, with Solskjaer's future in doubt following United's worst start to a Premier League campaign in 30 years.

(Image: Xavier Laine/Getty)

Foot Mercato have claimed that the Frenchman is keeping tabs on the situation in Manchester as he looks to secure a return to the dugout.

While Blanc has long dreamt of managing in the Premier League, it is the United position which interests him most.

United, once the dominant force in English football, have made their worst start to a Premier League campaign in 30 years and dropped to 12th in the table, two points above the relegation zone, after their 1-0 defeat at Newcastle .

Solskjaer is the fourth permanent manager to take charge since Ferguson retired in 2013, with the 20-times English champions enduring mixed fortunes under David Moyes, Louis van Gaal and Jose Mourinho despite spending heavily on players.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

The manager, who sanctioned the departures of Alexis Sanchez and Romelu Lukaku in the close season, is trying to rebuild the side with a greater emphasis on youth.

As such, the club signed centre back Harry Maguire, right back Aaron Wan-Bissaka and winger Daniel James before the season started.

But they've endured a miserable season so far and Solskjaer has come under increased pressure.
description: Laurent Blanc, who enjoyed a two-year playing spell with United before hanging up his boots, is keen on returning to management
